subject: Re: [junit] How to test a method without the return value by  junit?
msgSnippet: ... Presumably the methods change some member data - can t you test these through other methods? (And BTW, what on earth s the point of testing a class that
messageBody:
At 11:33 AM 09/10/01, you wrote:
>I am a newbie to junit.But now i have a job in my hand.I need to use
>JUnit to test some existed java programme.Some methods of classes
>have no return value.I can not change the source programme.How can I
>test these programme by JUnit?
>Thank you for your any help!


Presumably the methods change some member data - can't you test these
through other methods?

(And BTW, what on earth's the point of testing a class that you won't be
able to fix?)





--

* Jim Cheesman *
